headline: What is Title 42 and how does it affect the Arizona border? The immigration policy, explained
author: Clara Migoya
sentences: Under section 265 of the code, the surgeon general, or in this case the director of the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention, can prohibit the entry or "introduction" of non-citizens in the interest of public health if there is a "quarantinable communicable disease" in a foreign country and "serious danger" that it can be introduced into the United States.
